line: Okay, you see where you’re going? Let’s work on how to get there. Pan up to find...CLINT BARTON, with his daughter, LILA, coaching her as she notches an arrow in her bow.
Okay, good...tip down...bow arm out...three fingers-
Why three?
‘Cause two’s not enough and four’s too much-
You guys want mustard or mayo, or both? CLINT TURNS.  IN THE FIELD BEHIND THEM, his wife, LAURA BARTON sets up a picnic as COOPER and NATHANIEL play soccer.
Who puts mayo on a hot dog?
We’ll both have mustard, hon! (to Lila) Okay.  Draw back, deep breath... She lets loose.  THUD!  HER ARROW HITS NEAR THE BULLS-EYE.
Good job, Hawkeye.  Go get your arrow.
Enough murder practice!  Soup’s on!
One sec, babe.  Be right there! We’re gonna kill some hot dogs. We’re hungry. But when he turns back...LILA IS GONE.  The bow and arrow lie at his feet.  He stares.
Lila?  Babe, did you see Lila- He turns to his wife, BUT SHE’S GONE.  So are the boys.  The soccer ball rolls to a stop near the picnic blanket.
Guys?  Guys, come on... Clint walks toward the field, dread growing.
Laura? Clint breaks into a panicked run.
LAURA! Soon, THE BENATAR tumbles past, adrift... TONY STARK and NEBULA play table-top football.  She wins.
(offering his hand) Good sport.  Have fun? Nebula studies his hand, confused.  Finally she shakes.
It was fun. Tony, thin and haggard, kneels in front of HIS BROKEN IRON MAN HELMET.  He hits a switch.  A light blinks. TONY’S RECORDING: he stares directly into the “camera.”
This thing on?  Hey, Ms. Potts. Pep.  If you find this recording, don’t post it on social media. It’s going to be a real tearjerker. THE BENATAR sparks, adrift.
I don’t know if you’re ever going to see these.  I don’t even know if you’re still...God, I hope so. Today’s day twenty-one, no...twenty- two. NEBULA lasers shut Tony’s infected wound.

You know, if it wasn’t for the existential terror of staring into the literal void of space, I’d say I’m feeling a little better today. Infection’s run its course, thanks to the Blue Meanie back there. You’d like her.  She’s very practical.  And only a tiny bit sadistic.
The fuel cells were cracked during battle, but we figured out a way to reverse the ion charge.  Bought ourselves about 48 hours of flight time.  Problem is that was about...49 hours ago.
Which means, we’re dead in the water.  A thousand light years from the nearest 7-11. Tony hands Nebula the last of A PURPLE POWDER.  She pushes it back to him.
Most of the quote-unquote ‘food’ and potable water ran out two weeks ago. Tony stands on the flight deck, one hand resting on the glass, staring into the unknown.

Pep, I know I said no more surprises.  But, I gotta say, I was really hoping to pull off one last one.  But it looks like...well, you know what it looks like. Back to now.  Tony records his thoughts into his helmet.

Don’t feel bad about this.  I mean, actually, if you grovel for a couple weeks, and then move on with enormous guilt...I should probably lie down for a minute, rest my eyes.  Please know, when I drift off, it will be like every day lately.  I’m fine, totally fine. I’m going to dream about you.  It’s always you. Tony switches the helmet off. NEBULA finds TONY SPRAWLED ON THE FLOOR. Nebula helps Tony into Quill’s chair.  Tony slumps, completely still.  Nebula gives him his privacy. Move in on Tony’s face as...A LIGHT SLOWLY GROWS BRIGHTER. Soon, the entire flight deck glows as bright as a sun. Nebula appears from the galley, shading her eyes.  Tony’s eyelids flutter.  Finally, he opens them to see... CAPTAIN MARVEL (CAROL DANVERS) hovering in space. STEVE ROGERS shaves. He studies himself in the mirror, exhausted.  He’s about to tap his razor in the sink’s standing water, when... THE WATER RIPPLES.  Steve stares a beat, puzzled.  Then the lamp catches his eye...SWAYING GENTLY. Just then, a sound roars overhead.  Steve turns... THE MOON HANGS HUGE OVER THE EARTH.  Then the silhouette of THE BENATAR races past, propelled by CAROL DANVERS. Below...STEVE ROGERS, BRUCE BANNER, AND NATASHA ROMANOV watch a flying woman guide the ship to the ground. Behind them, PEPPER POTTS walks up to the group. Steve races up as NEBULA helps Tony down the ramp.
I couldn’t stop him.
Neither could we.
I lost the kid.
(unable to say it all) We...lost...
Is Pepper...?
Stay here, you stay right here-
I’m not going anywhere. NEARBY, NEBULA watches the sad humans.  ROCKET SITS BESIDE HER, GRATEFUL.  She rests a hand on his furry head. RHODEY, TONY, STEVE, NATASHA, AND CAROL watch...
It’s been twenty-three days since Thanos came to Earth. TONY, weak, sits in a hi-tech wheelchair, IV dripping into his arm.  He stares, taking in the loss: At Fury, Carol bites back emotion.

World governments are in pieces, as you can imagine.  But the parts that still work are trying to take a census.  It looks like he did what he said he was going to do. Finally, Tony looks away.  RHODEY turns it off.
Thanos wiped out fifty percent of all the living creatures on Earth.
Not just Earth.
You sure about that?
You never have to ask me that.
Where is he now?
We don’t know.  He just opened a portal and walked through. Tony looks out to see...THOR on the patio.
What’s his deal?
He’s pissed. Tony turns to see Rocket for the first time.
He thinks he failed.  Which, of course, he did.  But there’s a lot of that going around, ain’t there?
Until this second, I literally thought you were a Build-a-Bear.
We’ve been hunting Thanos for three weeks - deep space scans, satellites - we got nothing.  Tony, you fought him-
Who told you that?  I didn’t fight him, he wiped my face with a planet while a Bleecker Street magician gave away the store.  There was no fight because he’s not beatable.
Did he give you anything to go on? Clues, coordinates- Tony stares, lost, barely acknowledging Steve.
I saw this coming, few years back. Didn’t wanna believe.  I thought I was dreaming...
Tony, I need you to focus-
And I needed you, as in past tense. That trumps what you need.  It’s too late, buddy.  You know what I need? Tony turns to everyone, slightly unstable.

I need a shave and a burger, not a bowl of soup. (stands) And I believe I remember telling all of you, alive and otherwise, that we needed a suit of armor around the world, whether it impacted our precious freedoms or not-
But that didn’t work out, did it?

I said we’d lose, you said we’d “do that together, too.”  Guess what, Cap, we lost, and you weren’t there.  But that’s what we do, right?  Our best work after the fact?  We’re the “Avengers”, not the “Pre-vengers-”
Tony, take it easy...

I’ve got nothing for ya, Cap.  No coordinates, no clues, no strategies, no options.  Zero, zip, nada.  No trust. (rips out RT) Here.  You take this.  You find him, you put this on, and hide. (drops to his knees) I’m fine! Tony COLLAPSES.  Rhodey catches him. CAROL, STEVE, AND NATASHA stare through GLASS DOORS at TONY
Bruce gave him a sedative.  Should be out the rest of the day.
(heading for the lab) Take care of him.  When I come back, I’ll bring a bottle of Xorrian elixir.
Where are you going?
To kill Thanos. NATASHA catches up to CAROL IN THE WORKSHOP.
Hey, hey, hang on.  We’re sort of a team here.  Between you and me, morale’s a little fragile.
Oh, I’m sorry.  My fault. Carol sees Steve and Rhodey catch up.  She claps her hands.
All right, team!  I’m going to go kill Thanos.  Message me if you get any intel that can help. Otherwise, I’ll report back when he’s dead.  Great work, everybody.
Look, we realize “up there’s” more your territory, but this is our fight, too.
Do you even know where he is?
I know people who might-
Don’t bother. They all turn to see NEBULA in THE LIVING AREA DOORWAY.
I can tell you where Thanos is. STEVE, NATASHA, RHODEY, BANNER, ROCKET, THOR, and CAROL gather.  NEBULA studies her robotic hand.

Thanos spent a long time trying to...perfect me.  When he worked, he talked.  About his Great Plan. Even disassembled, I wanted to please him.  I’d ask, where would we go once his plan was complete? His answer was always the same: “To the Garden.”
You’re saying Thanos had a retirement plan.
Where’s this garden? ROCKET brings up EARTH on A HOLO-MAP.  A BRIGHT SURGE OF

When Thanos snapped his fingers, Earth become ground zero for a power surge of ridiculously cosmic proportions.  No one’s seen anything like it. He shifts the map, crossing billions of light years, to...AN
Until two days ago.
You’re saying he snapped his fingers again.  Where? Rocket zooms the holo-image toward a cluster of stars...
Planet is unnamed, but inhabitable. Rich atmosphere, good soil-
A garden.
Thanos is there.  And he just used the stones. Steve eyes everyone.  THOR FINALLY LOOKS UP.
(thinking of himself) You know, we’d be going short- handed.
Because he killed all our friends.
Are we saying they’re dead?  We’re using that word now?
He’s still got the stones.
So, we take them.  And we use them to bring everybody back.
Just like that?
Yeah.  Just like that. No one speaks.  Finally...
If there’s even the smallest chance we can undo this, then we owe it to everyone who’s not sitting here to try. Everyone looks around the room...AGREED.
If we do this...why would it end any differently than it did before?
Because before you didn’t have me.
Hey, new girl.  All of us in here are about that superhero life. Where’ve you been all this time?
There’s a lot of people in the universe.  And they didn’t all have you. THOR STANDS.  He crosses to Carol and holds out his hand. Carol doesn’t flinch.  Thor smiles.
I like this one. Steve stares at the planet a long, deciding moment.  Then...
Let’s go get that son of a bitch. EVERYONE settles into their seats on the Benatar’s flight deck.  STEVE WATCHES EARTH GROW SMALLER THROUGH THE WINDOW.
Trust me.  You get used to it. ROCKET looks around from the pilot’s chair.
Okay, who here hasn’t been to space? STEVE, NATASHA, and RHODEY half-raise their hands.
Oh, you’re gonna hate this.
Approaching jump in three, two... STEVE’S FINGERS TIGHTEN on the arm rest as... As the ship maintains orbit, CAROL flies toward the planet.
I’ll head down for recon.  If I’m not back in fifteen, you’ll know I found him. OUR HEROES wait on the flight deck, tense. NATASHA looks at STEVE, who’s staring at...A COMPASS: PEGGY
This is going to work, Steve.
I know it will. (beat) Because I don’t know what I’m going to do if it doesn’t.
No satellites, no ships, no armies. No ground defenses of any kind. It’s just him.

That’s enough. The Avengers exchange a look. A POT BOILS OVER A FIRE.  Then...THANOS LIMPS TOWARD IT, LEFT SIDE PARALYZED, arm blackened.  A shell of his former self. He stirs the pot.  Suddenly, AN ARMORED HAND BURSTS FROM THE Thanos jerks back as HULKBUSTER SPRINGS INSIDE.  CAROL AND THOR crashes through the door, followed by the others.  HE The Gauntlet lands at Rocket’s feet.  He picks it up...and his face goes slack.  He turns the glove toward the others. And we now realize...THE INFINITY STONES ARE GONE.
Where are they? Thanos doesn’t answer.  CAROL PRESSES HIM TO HIS KNEES.
Answer the question!
The universe required correction. After that, the stones served no purpose beyond temptation.
You murdered trillions.
You should be grateful.
Where are the stones?
Gone.  Reduced to atoms.
You used them two days ago!
I used the stones to destroy the stones.  It nearly killed me. But the work is done.  It always will be. That lands, sickening.  ROCKET SEARCHES, FRANTIC, NEAR TEARS.
No...they can’t be gone...
He’s lying.
My father is many things.  A liar is not one of them.
Thank you, daughter.  Perhaps I’ve treated you-
What did you do? Thor just stares, his long journey a failure.

I went for the head. As Thor walks away, Steve looks at Thanos’ head on the ground.  IT’S OVER.  THEY LOST. A CAR CRUSHER flattens an Audi.  THOUSANDS MORE NEVER-DRIVEN A HUGE TARP flaps over the shuttered LINCOLN CENTER. A TEENAGE GIRL rides her skateboard, alone in a weed-filled parking lot.  Pull back to see THE EMPTY STADIUM BEHIND HER. The bottom reads, “BROOKLYN SUPPORT GROUP, TUESDAYS 8PM.” A GRIEVING MAN speaks in A RECOVERY GROUP.
So, I went on a date the other day.
Good job, Bobby.  Back in the game.
Thank you, Jimmy. (to the group) First in five years.  I sat there at dinner thinking, what are we even supposed to talk about? STEVE ROGERS, thinner, older, LISTENS INTENTLY.
What did you talk about?
Same old crap.  How much things have changed.  How much we miss the Mets.  My job, his job.  Then it got kind of quiet.  He cried during the salads.
What about you?
I cried just before dessert.  But I’m seeing him again tomorrow. So...

That’s great.  You’ve already done the hardest part.  You took a jump, didn’t know where you’d come down. And that’s it, those little brave baby steps we’ve gotta take.  To try to make us feel whole again, to find a purpose... (to everyone) I went into the ice right after I met the love of my life.  Woke up seventy years later and...had to keep going. The group takes this in.

The world’s been left in our hands. If we don’t do something with it...then Thanos might as well have killed all of us. People nod, but Steve seems unconvinced by his own words. THE CAMERA ROTATES down from the sky onto a strangely quiet San Francisco, until it finds...A STORAGE WAREHOUSE. LUIS’ VAN sits in a storage unit, surrounded by boxes: “S. THROUGH THE VAN WINDOWS, we see...HANK PYM’S QUANTUM TUNNEL. STEPS ON A TOGGLE SWITCH and...A LIGHT GOES GREEN.  FLASH. THE BACK DOORS OF THE VAN BLOW OPEN, revealing...SCOTT LANG, ANT-MAN suit shorting.  He retracts his helmet, gasping. A GUARD reads THE TERMINAL BEACH, by J.G. Ballard.  He looks up at a monitor: SCOTT LANG holds up a sign, “HELP.” A dented WAGON rolls over a speed-bump.  Scott, in his old clothes, slowly wheels his belongings away. The Guard watches him go, puzzled. Scott walks A STREET OF ABANDONED HOMES.
Hello? He hears A CLACKING.  A KID on a bicycle rides by, playing card wedged between his spokes. Scott waves him down.  The kid stops.

Hey.  Kid.  What happened here? The kid says nothing.  He just stares at Scott with a haunted look.  Then he stands on his pedal and keeps riding. STONE MONUMENTS loom in a park.  A small crowd mills.  Reveal Scott looking over the monuments, lost. Scott walks up to the obelisks.  At the top, they read: “THE VANISHED.”  Hundreds of names line the stones. He scans the “L’s,” finally finding, “SCOTT LANG.”
What? (realizing) Cassie... A winded Scott races up the sidewalk toward his old house. He leaps a bush, banging on the front door.
Cassie!  Cassie! SOON, A TEEN GIRL opens the door, shocked.  A very long beat.
Dad?
Peanut? Scott wraps his arms around CASSIE LANG (14), now five years older than when he last saw her.  She hugs him, CRYING.
I thought you were gone.
I’m sorry.  I’m back...I’m back...I’m back... Avengers Compound stands amidst overgrown grass.  Rusty chains lock the gate. Faded signs warn: “RESTRICTED AREA.  KEEP OUT.”
We boarded that “highly suspect warship” Danvers pinged.
And?
It was an infectious garbage scow.
So thanks for the hot tip-
You were closer.
And now we smell like garbage-
(to Okoye) You get a reading on those tremors?
Minor subduction in the African plate.
Do we have a visual?  How are you handling it?
Nat.  It was a mild earthquake.  In the ocean.  We handle it by not handling it. Natasha looks burdened.  Rhodey steps in.
I can have NASA redirect a satellite, do a sweep just to make sure.
Thanks.  Carol, you’re still coming our way next month?
Not likely.
Getting another haircut?

Listen, fur-face, I’m covering a lot of territory out here.  The things that have been happening on Earth have been happening everywhere else.  On thousands of planets.  You might not see me for a long time.

All right.  Everybody keep keeping their eyes open.  This channel’s always active.  Anything goes sideways, anyone makes trouble where they shouldn’t, it comes through me. They ad lib their goodbyes as they sign off, except Rhodey.
What’s up?  Where are you?
Mexico.  Got some news.
Okay...
Federalés found a room full of bodies outside Juarez.  Cartel guys.  Guns still in their pants.
Could be a rival hit-
But it wasn’t.  Same MO as Marseille.  And Kiev.
(beat) It’s definitely Barton. She nods, grim, reluctantly accepting.
What he’s done here...what he’s been doing...I got to tell you, part of me doesn’t want to find him. Natasha just stares a long beat.
Find out where’s he going next. Rhodey nods, signing off.  Natasha sits there, THEN CRUMPLES. After a long beat...
I’d offer to cook you dinner but you seem sad enough already. Natasha turns to see STEVE in the doorway.
Come by to do your laundry?
And see a friend.
Your friend’s fine.
She leave the house today?
Nothing out there I particularly want to see.
I spotted a pod of whales coming over the bridge.
(dubious) In the Hudson.
Fewer ships, cleaner water.  Just saying, there’s still a world out there.
If you’re about to tell me to look on the bright side, I’m about to hit you with a peanut butter sandwich. Steve relents, LETTING DOWN HIS FACADE.
Sorry.  Force of habit.
I don’t know how you do it. Steve bites into the uneaten half of her sandwich.
I guess I don’t know how not to.
Me, neither. After a long moment, Steve looks up at her, honest.
I keep telling them, move on.  Grow past it.  And some of them actually do.  But not us.
If I move on, who does this?
Maybe it doesn’t need to be done. Natasha takes that in.  Steve is thinking of giving up.  She looks around at Avengers Compound.
I used to have nothing.  Then I got this.  This job, this family.  And I was better because of it. She chokes slightly, collecting herself.
And even though they’re gone, I’m still trying to be...better.
I think we both need to get a life.
You first. They stare at each other a long, melancholy moment.
Hello?  Is anyone home?  This is, uh, Scott Lang?  We met a few years ago.  At the airport?
This an old message?
(stunned) It’s the front gate. SCOTT paces, mumbling to himself.
Scott, are you okay?
What?  Yes. He turns to STEVE and NATASHA.
Have either of you guys ever studied quantum physics?
Only to make conversation. Steve glances at her.  She shrugs.

Well, five years ago, just before this Thanos guy...I went into a place called the Quantum Realm. It’s like its own microscopic universe.  You can only get there if you’re incredibly small.  Hope, she’s my...she was supposed to pull me out.  But then Thanos happened. And I was stuck in there.
I’m sorry.  It must’ve been a long five years.

(getting excited) Okay, but that’s the thing.  It wasn’t.  For me, it was only five hours.  The rules in the Quantum Realm aren’t like out here. They’re completely unpredictable. Is anybody gonna eat that sandwich?
Scott, what are you talking about?
Time works differently in the Quantum Realm. Steve and Natasha share a look.

Problem is, right now, it’s chaos, there’s no way to navigate it.  But what if we could figure out a way to enter the Quantum Realm at a certain point in time...and come out in another.  Like, before Thanos-
Wait...wait.  Scott.  Are you talking about a time machine?
No, not a machine.  More like a... (searches, then gives up) Yeah, like a time machine.  I know it sounds crazy...
Scott, I get emails from a raccoon. Nothing’s crazy anymore.
So, who do we talk to about this? LLAMAS and FARM ANIMALS GRAZE A RUSTIC-TECH ECO-COMPOUND. TONY approaches A WOODED GLADE near the house.
Morgan H. Stark.  Chow time.  Want some lunch? Silence.  Then MORGAN STARK (4) steps out of her play tent, wearing A PURPLE-BLUE IRON MAN HELMET (RESCUE).
Define lunch or be disintegrated.
You should not be wearing that. It’s part of a special anniversary gift I made for Mom.  You thinking about lunch? Tony gently takes the helmet off, revealing A YOUNG GIRL.
Where’d you find this?
Garage. Tony picks her up, walking toward the house.

You like going in the garage?  So does Daddy.  It’s all right.  Mommy never wears what I buy her. Tony and Morgan exit the woods.  Suddenly, Tony stops. In the driveway, STEVE ROGERS stares at him.  NATASHA AND STEVE, SCOTT, and NATASHA sit with TONY.
I just want to thank you folks for dropping by.  It’s not every day one gets to contemplate biting it on an inter-dimensional timescape.
You’ve got some objections to the plan.
So you’re calling it a plan.  To me, it sounds like an exotic suicide method.  Not to mention, it’s impossible.
We know what it sounds like.
Tony, after what you’ve seen, is anything really impossible?

Quantum fluctuation kinda messes with the Planck Scale, which then triggers the Deutsch Proposition, can we agree on that? (offering more tea) Chai? (back on message) In layman’s terms, it means you can cancel your Netflix subscription because you’re not coming home.
I did.
Which was a billion-to-one cosmic fluke.  Now you want to pull a- What are you calling it?
A time heist.
Oh, of course, a time heist, why didn’t we think of this before? Right, because it’s a pipe dream. Who are you again?
Still Scott...
Tony, the Stones exist in the past. We could get them and bring them here.
We can snap our own fingers.  We can bring everybody back.
Or screw it up worse than he already has.
I don’t believe we would. Tony stares at Steve, a lot of water under the bridge.

Gotta say it.  Sometimes I’ve missed that giddy optimism.  Sadly, all your high hopes won’t help me if there’s no logical, tangible way for me to safely execute said “time heist.”  I believe the most likely outcome would be our collective demise.
Not if we strictly follow the rules of time travel.  No talking to our past selves.  No betting on sporting events-
Stop, Scott.  Stop.  Are you telling me that your plan to save the universe is more than loosely based on Back to the Future?
(meaning “yes”) No...
Good.  Because that would be horseshit.  Scientifically speaking, your brother’s picture doesn’t disappear just ‘cause you went to the dance with your mom. That’s not how quantum physics works.
We have to take a stand.
We did stand.  And yet here we are.
Look, Stark-  Can I call you Tony?
Please don’t-
Tony-
Fine.

I get that you’ve got a lot on the line, here.  You’ve got a wife.  A daughter.  But I lost someone very important - a lot of us did - and now we have a chance to save her, and everyone else, and you won’t even-
No, Scott.  I won’t.  Even. Suddenly, MORGAN walks onto the porch.
Mommy told me to come save you. Tony takes Morgan into his arms and heads inside.
Good job.  I’m saved. (to Steve) I wish you were coming here to ask me something else.  I’m honestly happy to see you.  If you want to stay- Steve tries one last time.
Tony, I get it.  And I’m happy for you.  I am.  But this is a second chance.

Yeah, well, I got my second chance right here.  I can’t roll the dice on it.  The table is set for six. If you don’t talk shop, you’re welcome to stay for lunch. He exits. Steve, Natasha, and Scott walk toward the car.
He’s scared.
He’s not wrong.
What are we gonna do?  We need him. You want to stop?
No.  I want to do it right. (beat) We’re going to need a really big brain.
Bigger than his? ONLOOKERS crowd a diner window, trying to peek inside.
I’m confused.
These are confusing times.
No, that’s not what I’m-
I’m kidding, I get it.  It’s crazy. I wear shirts now!
But why?
Five years ago, we got our asses kicked, right? --- Smart Hulk eats a stack of pancakes in two bites.
He’s heard.
It was worse for me.  Because I lost twice.  First Hulk lost.  Then Banner lost.  Then we all lost.
No one blamed you, Bruce.
I did-  I feel like I’m the only one eating.  Here, try some. He holds out a pizza.  They decline.  He shrugs.
Thing is, I kept thinking, it didn’t have to be that way.  That the best of Banner and best of Hulk, if they’d worked together, maybe they could’ve stopped Thanos.
Okay.  But how did...this happen?
For years I treated the Hulk like a disease, something to get rid of. But when I started treating him like the cure... Smart Hulk MESHES HIS FINGERS together.
Eighteen months in the Gamma Lab. I put the brains and the brawn together.  And now look at me. Best of both worlds. TWO KIDS amble up to the booth.
Mr. Hulk?  Can we get a picture?
100%, little lady. The kid hands a phone to Steve.  SMART HULK makes a duck face as Steve sheepishly snaps the pic, handing the phone back.
(to the fan) Thanks, pal.  Hulk out!
So, Bruce, about what we said-
The time travel do-over?  I don’t know, that’s kind of outside my field of expertise... Natasha nods at his Smart Hulk-ness, history between them.
You pulled this off.  I remember a time that was impossible, too. He considers, then finally relents, pulling out his phone.

I’m supposed to be on Oprah next week, but I guess I could move things around. TONY STARK DOES DISHES.  He rinses with the sprayer.  It goes everywhere.  He wipes down the counter, including... A PICTURE OF PETER PARKER.  He stares. Tony builds HOLO MODELS: Penrose diagrams, wormholes.  He studies a STAR-SHAPED CAPACITOR, intrigued.
Friday, you up?
Yes, sir.
I’ve had a mild inspiration, like to see if it checks out.  I would like to run one last sim before we pack it in for the night.  This time, in the shape of a Mobius Strip, inverted.
Processing. The model forms.
All right, give me the eigenvalue of that particle, factoring in spectral decomp.  Run it.  That’ll take a second.  And don’t worry if it doesn’t pan out, I’m just kind of...
Model rendered.
(in awe) Shit.
Shit. Tony turns to see HIS DAUGHTER in the doorway.
What are you doing up?
Shit.
First of all, that’s a Mommy word, she coined it.
Why are you up?
I just had something on my mind.
Was it juice pops?
Correct.  Great minds think alike. What kind do you want? Morgan eats A JUICE POP in bed.  Tony watches.
You done? (finishing her popsicle) Now you are.
Tell me a story.
Once upon a time, Maguna went to bed.  The end.
That was a bad story. He runs his hand over her hair.
Love you tons.
Love you three thousand.
Wow, that’s a lot. Tony turns out the light, exits. PHOTOS crowd a side table: Pepper, Morgan, Tony.  Even one of Find...PEPPER, curled up on the couch reading.  Then...
Out like a light.  Don’t know how much she loves you but she loves me three thousand.
That’s up there.
What’re you reading?
A book about composting-
I think I solved it. Pepper looks up.
Just so we’re both talking about the same thing-
Time travel.
That’s amazing.
Yeah.
And terrifying.
To say the least. He sits beside her.  She stares, SHARING IN HIS DILEMMA.
We got really lucky-
I know-
Not everybody did.
I can’t help everybody.
Except, it sort of seems like you can.
Not if I stopped right here.
